HIDDEN		 - -
ai_actbusy_search_time 10.0 GAMEDLL - -
ai_auto_contact_solver 1 GAMEDLL - -
ai_block_damage 0 GAMEDLL - -
ai_clear_bad_links cmd GAMEDLL - Clears bits set on nav links indicating link is unusable
ai_debug_actbusy 0 GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Used to debug actbusy behavior. Usage: 1: Constantly draw lines from NPCs to the actbusy nodes they've chosen to actbusy at. 2: Whenever an NPC makes a decision to use an actbusy, show which actbusy they've chosen. 3: Selected NPCs (with npc_select) will report why they're not choosing actbusy nodes. 4: Display debug output of actbusy logic. 5: Display safe zone volumes and info.

ai_debug_avoidancebounds 0 GAMEDLL - -
ai_debug_directnavprobe 0 GAMEDLL - -
ai_debug_doors 0 GAMEDLL - -
ai_debug_dyninteractions 0 GAMEDLL - Debug the NPC dynamic interaction system.
ai_debug_efficiency 0 GAMEDLL - -
ai_debug_enemies 0 GAMEDLL - -
ai_debug_enemyfinders 0 GAMEDLL - -
ai_debug_eventresponses 0 GAMEDLL - Set to 1 to see all NPC response events trigger, and which NPCs choose to respond to them.
ai_debug_expressions 0 GAMEDLL - Show random expression decisions for NPCs.
ai_debug_follow 0 GAMEDLL - -
ai_debug_loners 0 GAMEDLL - -
ai_debug_looktargets 0 GAMEDLL - -
ai_debug_los 0 GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - NPC Line-Of-Sight debug mode. If 1, solid entities that block NPC LOC will be highlighted with white bounding boxes. If 2, it'll show non-solid entities that would do it if they were solid.
ai_debug_nav 0 GAMEDLL - -
ai_debug_node_connect cmd GAMEDLL - Debug the attempted connection between two nodes

ai_disable cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Bi-passes all AI logic routines and puts all NPCs into their idle animations. Can be used to get NPCs out of your way and to test effect of AI logic routines on frame rate

ai_nodes cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Toggles node display. First call displays the nodes for the given network as green objects. Second call displays the nodes and their IDs. Nodes are color coded as follows: Green - ground node Cyan - air node Magenta - climb node Grey - node not available for selected hull size Orange - node currently locked

CHEAT
SS		 - If NPC is stepping through tasks (see ai_step ) will resume normal processing.

ai_set_move_height_epsilon cmd GAMEDLL - Set how high AI bumps up ground walkers when checking steps

CHEAT
SS		 - Like ai_disable but you manually specify the state (with a 0 or 1) instead of toggling it.

ai_show_connect cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type. Hulls are color code as follows: Green - ground movement Blue - jumping movement Cyan - flying movement Yellow - crawling movement Magenta - climbing movement Red - connection disabled
ai_show_connect_crawl cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type. Hulls are color code as follows: Green - ground movement Blue - jumping movement Cyan - flying movement Yellow - crawling movement Magenta - climbing movement Red - connection disabled
ai_show_connect_fly cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type. Hulls are color code as follows: Green - ground movement Blue - jumping movement Cyan - flying movement Yellow - crawling movement Magenta - climbing movement Red - connection disabled
ai_show_connect_jump cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type. Hulls are color code as follows: Green - ground movement Blue - jumping movement Cyan - flying movement Yellow - crawling movement Magenta - climbing movement Red - connection disabled
ai_show_graph_connect cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Toggles graph connection display for the node that the player is looking at. Nodes that are connected to the selected node by the net graph will be drawn in red with magenta lines connecting to the selected node. Nodes that are not connected via the net graph from the selected node will be drawn in blue.
ai_show_grid cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Draw a grid on the floor where looking.
ai_show_hints cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Displays all hints as small boxes Blue - hint is available for use Red - hint is currently being used by an NPC Orange - hint not being used by timed out Grey - hint has been disabled
ai_show_hull cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Displays the allowed hulls between each node for the currently selected hull type. Hulls are color code as follows: Green - ground movement Blue - jumping movement Cyan - flying movement Yellow - crawling movement Magenta - climbing movement Arguments: -none-
ai_show_hull_attacks 0 GAMEDLL - -
ai_show_node cmd GAMEDLL - Highlight the specified node
ai_show_think_tolerance 0 GAMEDLL - -
ai_show_visibility cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Toggles visibility display for the node that the player is looking at. Nodes that are visible from the selected node will be drawn in red with yellow lines connecting to the selected node. Nodes that are not visible from the selected node will be drawn in blue.
ai_simulate_task_overtime 0 GAMEDLL - -
ai_spread_cone_focus_time 0.6 GAMEDLL - -
ai_spread_defocused_cone_multiplier 3.0 GAMEDLL - -
ai_spread_pattern_focus_time 0.8 GAMEDLL - -
ai_step cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - NPCs will freeze after completing their current task. To complete the next task, use 'ai_step' again. To resume processing normally use 'ai_resume'

HIDDEN		 - -
bench_end cmd CHEAT
SS		 - Ends gathering of info.
bench_start cmd CHEAT
SS		 - Starts gathering of info. Arguments: filename to write results into
bench_upload cmd CHEAT
SS		 - Uploads most recent benchmark stats to the Valve servers.
benchframe cmd NONE - Takes a snapshot of a particular frame in a time demo.
bind cmd NONE - Bind a key.
bind_osx cmd NONE - Bind a key for OSX only.
BindToggle cmd NONE - Performs a bind <key> "increment var <cvar> 0 1 1"

BlendBonesMode 2 CLIENTDLL
REPLICATED		 - -
blink_duration 0.2 CLIENTDLL - How many seconds an eye blink will last.
blob_csection_pool_block_size 100 DEVELOPMENTONLY
CLIENTDLL		 - The blob renderer will allocate/free CSections in blocks of this size (smaller values may save some memory but will definitely increase CPU cost)
blob_csection_pool_enable 1 DEVELOPMENTONLY
CLIENTDLL		 - When enabled, the blob renderer uses a shared pool to recycle CSection objects, which drastically reduces memory usage
blob_csection_pool_free_per_frame 15 DEVELOPMENTONLY
CLIENTDLL		 - The blob renderer will free this many CSections from the shared pool each frame (larger values save memory but increase CPU cost)
blob_csection_pool_size 4000 DEVELOPMENTONLY
CLIENTDLL		 - The maximum number of CSections to be recycled in the shared pool (smaller values save memory but increase CPU cost)
blob_csection_pool_spew 0 DEVELOPMENTONLY
CLIENTDLL		 - Spew usage stats about the blob renderer's shared CSection pool (more data will be available if blobulator is built in DEBUG)
blobs_paused 0 CLIENTDLL
REPLICATED
CHEAT
SS		 - -

CHEAT
SS		 - Add a bot.

CHEAT
SS		 - <bot name> <command string...>. Sends specified command on behalf of specified bot
bot_defend 0 GAMEDLL - Set to a team number, and that team will all keep their combat shields raised.

CHEAT
SS		 - -
bot_equip cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Generate an item and have the bot equip it. Format: bot_equip <bot name> <item name>
bot_flipout 0 GAMEDLL - When on, all bots fire their guns.
bot_follow 0 GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - When on, bot will follow the player.
bot_following_distance 200.f GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - distance that bot will follow the player.
bot_forceattack2 0 GAMEDLL - When firing, use attack2.
bot_forceattackon 0 GAMEDLL - When firing, don't tap fire, hold it down.
bot_forcefireweapon GAMEDLL - Force bots with the specified weapon to fire.
bot_jump 0 GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Force all bots to repeatedly jump.

CHEAT
SS		 - <bot id>. Kills bot.

CHEAT
SS		 - When on, bot will look at what the player is looking.
bot_mimic 0 GAMEDLL - Bot uses usercmd of player by index.
bot_mimic_yaw_offset 180 GAMEDLL - Offsets the bot yaw.

CHEAT

SS		 - Force all bots to repeatedly taunt.

CHEAT
SS		 - When on, bot will throw current weapon.
bounce_auto_trigger_min_speed 500 DEVELOPMENTONLY
CLIENTDLL
REPLICATED		 - At what speed the player will auto-bounce when running over bounce paint.
bounce_ledge_fall_height_boost 45 DEVELOPMENTONLY
CLIENTDLL
REPLICATED		 - Toggle whether bounce reflections after falling off a ledge without jumping add upward hop velocity on the first bounce.
bounce_paint_color 0 165 255 255 CLIENTDLL
REPLICATED		 - Color for bounce paint
bounce_paint_min_speed 500.0f CLIENTDLL
REPLICATED
CHEAT
SS		 - For tweaking how high bounce paint launches the player.
bounce_paint_wall_jump_upward_speed 275 CLIENTDLL
REPLICATED
CHEAT
SS		 - The upward velocity added when bouncing off a wall
bounce_reflect_restitution 1.0 DEVELOPMENTONLY
CLIENTDLL
REPLICATED
CHEAT
SS		 - The elasticity of a collision with a bounce paint surface. Values should be in the range [0, 1].
bounce_reflect_wall_jump_min_up_speed 10.0 DEVELOPMENTONLY
CLIENTDLL
REPLICATED
CHEAT
SS		 - The minimum upward speed the player will jump off the wall with when reflection bounce wall jumps are enabled.
bounce_reflect_wall_jumps_enabled 1 DEVELOPMENTONLY
CLIENTDLL
REPLICATED
CHEAT
SS		 - Enable/Disable wall jumps for reflection bounce.
box cmd CHEAT
SS		 - Draw a debug box.
breakable_disable_gib_limit 0 GAMEDLL - -
breakable_multiplayer 1 GAMEDLL - -
buddha cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Toggle. Player takes damage but won't die. (Shows red cross when health is zero)
budget_averages_window 30 ARCHIVE - number of frames to look at when figuring out average frametimes
budget_background_alpha 128 ARCHIVE - how translucent the budget panel is
budget_bargraph_background_alpha 128 ARCHIVE - how translucent the budget panel is
budget_bargraph_range_ms 16.6666666667 ARCHIVE - budget bargraph range in milliseconds
budget_history_numsamplesvisible 100 ARCHIVE - number of samples to draw in the budget history window. The lower the better as far as rendering overhead of the budget panel
budget_history_range_ms 66.666666667 ARCHIVE - budget history range in milliseconds
budget_panel_bottom_of_history_fraction .25 ARCHIVE - number between 0 and 1
budget_panel_height 384 ARCHIVE - height in pixels of the budget panel
budget_panel_width 512 ARCHIVE - width in pixels of the budget panel
budget_panel_x 0 ARCHIVE - number of pixels from the left side of the game screen to draw the budget panel
budget_panel_y 50 ARCHIVE - number of pixels from the top side of the game screen to draw the budget panel
budget_peaks_window 30 ARCHIVE - number of frames to look at when figuring out peak frametimes
budget_show_averages 0 ARCHIVE - enable/disable averages in the budget panel
budget_show_history 1 ARCHIVE - turn history graph off and on. . good to turn off on low end
budget_show_peaks 1 ARCHIVE - enable/disable peaks in the budget panel
budget_toggle_group cmd NONE - Turn a budget group on/off
bug cmd DONTRECORD - Show the bug reporting UI.
bug_swap cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Automatically swaps the current weapon for the bug bait and back again.
bugreporter_console_bytes 15000 NONE - Max # of console bytes to put into bug report body (full text still attached).

cl_clearhinthistory cmd CLIENTDLL - Clear memory of client side hints displayed to the player.
cl_clock_correction 1 CHEAT
SS		 - Enable/disable clock correction on the client.
cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_amount 200 CHEAT
SS		 - Sets the maximum number of milliseconds per second it is allowed to correct the client clock. It will only correct this amount if the difference between the client and server clock is equal to or larger than cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_offset.
cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_offset 90 CHEAT
SS		 - As the clock offset goes from cl_clock_correction_adjustment_min_offset to this value (in milliseconds), it moves towards applying cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_amount of adjustment. That way, the response is small when the offset is small.
cl_clock_correction_adjustment_min_offset 10 CHEAT
SS		 - If the clock offset is less than this amount (in milliseconds), then no clock correction is applied.
cl_clock_correction_force_server_tick 999 CHEAT
SS		 - Force clock correction to match the server tick + this offset (-999 disables it).
cl_clock_showdebuginfo 0 CHEAT
SS		 - Show debugging info about the clock drift.
cl_clockdrift_max_ms 150 CHEAT
SS		 - Maximum number of milliseconds the clock is allowed to drift before the client snaps its clock to the server's.
cl_clockdrift_max_ms_threadmode 0 CHEAT
SS		 - Maximum number of milliseconds the clock is allowed to drift before the client snaps its clock to the server's.

USERINFO		 - Max number of command packets sent to server per second

con_filter_enable 0 MATERIAL_SYSTEM_THREAD - Filters console output based on the setting of con_filter_text. 1 filters completely, 2 displays filtered text brighter than other text.

con_filter_text_out MATERIAL_SYSTEM_THREAD - Text with which to filter OUT of console spew. Set con_filter_enable 1 or 2 to activate.

ent_orient cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Orient the specified entity to match the player's angles. By default, only orients target entity's YAW. Use the 'allangles' option to orient on all axis. Format: ent_orient <entity name> <optional: allangles>
ent_pause cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Toggles pausing of input/output message processing for entities. When turned on processing of all message will stop. Any messages displayed with 'ent_messages' will stop fading and be displayed indefinitely. To step through the messages one by one use 'ent_step'.

fs_fios_cancel_prefetches cmd NONE - Cancels all the prefetches in progress.
fs_fios_flush_cache cmd NONE - Flushes the FIOS HDD cache.
fs_fios_prefetch_file cmd NONE - Prefetches a file: </PS3_GAME/USRDIR/filename.bin>. The preftech is medium priority and persistent.
fs_fios_prefetch_file_in_pack cmd NONE - Prefetches a file in a pack: <portal2/models/container_ride/fineDebris_part5.ani>. The preftech is medium priority and non-persistent.
fs_fios_print_prefetches cmd NONE - Displays all the prefetches currently in progress.
fs_monitor_read_from_pack 0 NONE - 0:Off, 1:Any, 2:Sync only
fs_printopenfiles cmd NONE - Show all files currently opened by the engine.
fs_report_long_reads 0 NONE - 0:Off, 1:All (for tracking accumulated duplicate read times), >1:Microsecond threshold
fs_report_sync_opens 0 NONE - 0:Off, 1:Always, 2:Not during map load
fs_report_sync_opens_callstack 0 NONE - 0 to not display the call-stack when we hit a fs_report_sync_opens warning. Set to 1 to display the call-stack.

fs_warning_level cmd NONE - Set the filesystem warning level.
fs_warning_mode 0 NONE - 0:Off, 1:Warn main thread, 2:Warn other threads

lservercfgfile listenserver.cfg GAMEDLL - -
m_customaccel 0 CLIENTDLL
ARCHIVE		 - Custom mouse acceleration: 0: custom accelaration disabled 1: mouse_acceleration = min(m_customaccel_max, pow(raw_mouse_delta, m_customaccel_exponent) * m_customaccel_scale + sensitivity) 2: Same as 1, with but x and y sensitivity are scaled by m_pitch and m_yaw respectively. 3: mouse_acceleration = pow(raw_mouse_delta, m_customaccel_exponent - 1) * sensitivity
m_customaccel_exponent 1.3 CLIENTDLL
ARCHIVE		 - Mouse move is raised to this power before being scaled by scale factor.
m_customaccel_max 0 CLIENTDLL
ARCHIVE		 - Max mouse move scale factor, 0 for no limit
m_customaccel_scale 0.04 CLIENTDLL
ARCHIVE		 - Custom mouse acceleration value.
m_forward 1 CLIENTDLL
ARCHIVE		 - Mouse forward factor.
m_mouseaccel1 0 CLIENTDLL
ARCHIVE		 - Windows mouse acceleration initial threshold (2x movement).
m_mouseaccel2 0 CLIENTDLL
ARCHIVE		 - Windows mouse acceleration secondary threshold (4x movement).
m_mousespeed 1 CLIENTDLL
ARCHIVE		 - Windows mouse acceleration (0 to disable, 1 to enable [Windows 2000: enable initial threshold], 2 to enable secondary threshold [Windows 2000 only]).
m_pitch 0.022 CLIENTDLL
ARCHIVE		 - Mouse pitch factor.
m_pitch2 0.022 CLIENTDLL
ARCHIVE
SS_ADDED		 - Mouse pitch factor.
m_rawinput 0 CLIENTDLL
ARCHIVE		 - Use Raw Input for mouse input.
m_side 0.8 CLIENTDLL
ARCHIVE		 - Mouse side factor.
m_yaw 0.022 CLIENTDLL
ARCHIVE		 - Mouse yaw factor.

mat_leafvis_draw_mask 3 NONE - A bitfield which affects leaf visibility debug rendering. -1: show all, bit 0: render PVS-visible leafs, bit 1: render PVS- and frustum-visible leafs, bit 2: render frustum bounds, bit 3: render leaves out of PVS.
mat_leafvis_freeze 0 NONE - If set to 1, uses the last known leaf visibility data for visualization. If set to 0, updates based on camera movement.

mat_software_aa_blur_one_pixel_lines 0.5 CLIENTDLL - How much software AA should blur one-pixel thick lines: (0.0 - none), (1.0 - lots)
mat_software_aa_debug 0 CLIENTDLL - Software AA debug mode: (0 - off), (1 - show number of 'unlike' samples: 0->black, 1->red, 2->green, 3->blue), (2 - show anti-alias blend strength), (3 - show averaged 'unlike' colour)
mat_software_aa_edge_threshold 1.0 CLIENTDLL - Software AA - adjusts the sensitivity of the software AA shader's edge detection (default 1.0 - a lower value will soften more edges, a higher value will soften fewer)
mat_software_aa_quality 0 CLIENTDLL - Software AA quality mode: (0 - 5-tap filter), (1 - 9-tap filter)
mat_software_aa_strength -1.0 CLIENTDLL - Software AA - perform a software anti-aliasing post-process (an alternative/supplement to MSAA). This value sets the strength of the effect: (0.0 - off), (1.0 - full)
mat_software_aa_strength_vgui -1.0 CLIENTDLL - Same as mat_software_aa_strength, but forced to this value when called by the post vgui AA pass.
mat_software_aa_tap_offset 1.0 CLIENTDLL - Software AA - adjusts the displacement of the taps used by the software AA shader (default 1.0 - a lower value will make the image sharper, higher will make it blurrier)

mat_tessellationlevel 6 CHEAT
SS
MATERIAL_SYSTEM_THREAD		 - -
mat_texture_limit -1 NEVER_AS_STRING
MATERIAL_SYSTEM_THREAD		 - If this value is not -1, the material system will limit the amount of texture memory it uses in a frame. Useful for identifying performance cliffs. The value is in kilobytes.
mat_texture_list 0 NONE - For debugging, show a list of used textures per frame
mat_texture_list_all 0 NEVER_AS_STRING - If this is nonzero, then the texture list panel will show all currently-loaded textures.
mat_texture_list_all_frames 2 NONE - How many frames to sample texture memory for all textures.
mat_texture_list_content_path ARCHIVE Windows The content path to the materialsrc directory. If left unset, it'll assume your content directory is next to the currently running game dir.
mat_texture_list_exclude cmd DONTRECORD Windows 'load' - loads the exclude list file, 'reset' - resets all loaded exclude information, 'save' - saves exclude list file
mat_texture_list_exclude_editing 0 NONE - -
mat_texture_list_txlod cmd DONTRECORD - Adjust LOD of the last viewed texture +1 to inc resolution, -1 to dec resolution
mat_texture_list_txlod_sync cmd DONTRECORD Windows 'reset' - resets all run-time changes to LOD overrides, 'save' - saves all changes to material content files
mat_texture_list_view 1 NEVER_AS_STRING - If this is nonzero, then the texture list panel will render thumbnails of currently-loaded textures.

SS		 - 0 = Original Algorithm 1 = New Algorithm

mm_dedicated_allow 1 DEVELOPMENTONLY - 1 = allow searches for dedicated servers
mm_dedicated_fake 0 DEVELOPMENTONLY - 1 = pretend like search is going, but abort after some time
mm_dedicated_force_servers RELEASE - Comma delimited list of ip:port of servers used to search for dedicated servers instead of searching for public servers. Use syntax `publicip1:port|privateip1:port,publicip2:port|privateip2:port` if your server is behind NAT. If the server is behind NAT, you can specify `0.0.0.0|privateip:port` and if server port is in the list of `mm_server_search_lan_ports` its public address should be automatically detected.
mm_dedicated_ip DEVELOPMENTONLY - IP address of dedicated servers to consider available

SS		 - To connect two Areas, mark the first Area, highlight the second Area, then invoke the connect command. Note that this creates a ONE-WAY connection from the first to the second Area. To make a two-way connection, also connect the second area to the first.

CHEAT

CHEAT
SS		 - Mark the current location as a walkable position. These positions are used as seed locations when sampling the map to generate a Navigation Mesh.

CHEAT
SS		 - Maximum range for precomputed nav mesh visibility (0 = default 1500 units)

CHEAT
SS		 - To merge two Areas into one, mark the first Area, highlight the second by pointing your cursor at it, and invoke the merge command.

CHEAT
SS		 - Merges a saved selected set into the current mesh.

CHEAT
SS		 - Toggles the 'hostages cannot use this area' flag used by the AI system.
nav_no_jump cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Toggles the 'dont jump in this area' flag used by the AI system.
nav_place_floodfill cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Sets the Place of the Area under the cursor to the curent Place, and 'flood-fills' the Place to all adjacent Areas. Flood-filling stops when it hits an Area with the same Place, or a different Place than that of the initial Area.
nav_place_list cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Lists all place names used in the map.
nav_place_pick cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Sets the current Place to the Place of the Area under the cursor.
nav_place_replace cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Replaces all instances of the first place with the second place.
nav_place_set cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Sets the Place of all selected areas to the current Place.

CHEAT
SS		 - -

CHEAT
SS		 - Toggles the 'dont avoid obstacles' flag used by the AI system.

CHEAT
SS		 - Set to one to skip the time consuming phases of the analysis. Useful for data collection and testing.

CHEAT
SS		 - Raise the bottom of the drag select volume.
nav_recall_selected_set cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Re-selects the stored selected set.
nav_remove_from_selected_set cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Remove current area from the selected set.
nav_remove_jump_areas cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Removes legacy jump areas, replacing them with connections.
nav_run cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Toggles the 'traverse this area by running' flag used by the AI system.

CHEAT
SS		 - Saves the current Navigation Mesh to disk.
nav_save_selected cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Writes the selected set to disk for merging into another mesh via nav_merge_mesh.

CHEAT
SS		 - Adds all blocked areas to the selected set

CHEAT
SS		 - Adds all damaging areas to the selected set

CHEAT
SS		 - Selects any areas that intersect the given half-space.

CHEAT
SS		 - Adds all invalid areas to the Selected Set.

CHEAT
SS		 - Adds all obstructed areas to the selected set

CHEAT
SS		 - Adds all areas in a radius to the selection set
nav_select_stairs cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Adds all stairway areas to the selected set

CHEAT
SS		 - Color used to draw the selected set borders while editing.

CHEAT
SS		 - Color used to draw the selected set background while editing.

CHEAT
SS		 - Sets the editor into or out of Place mode. Place mode allows labelling of Area with Place names.
nav_shift cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Shifts the selected areas by the specified amount

SS		 - Show Approach Points in the Navigation Mesh.

CHEAT
SS		 - Chops all selected areas into their component 1x1 areas and re-merges them together into larger areas
nav_slope_limit 0.7 GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - The ground unit normal's Z component must be greater than this for nav areas to be generated.
nav_slope_tolerance 0.1 GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - The ground unit normal's Z component must be this close to the nav area's Z component to be generated.
nav_snap_to_grid 0 GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Snap to the nav generation grid when creating new nav areas
nav_solid_props 0 GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Make props solid to nav generation/editing
nav_splice cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - To splice, mark an area, highlight a second area, then invoke the splice command to create a new, connected area between them.
nav_split cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - To split an Area into two, align the split line using your cursor and invoke the split command.
nav_split_place_on_ground 0 GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - If true, nav areas will be placed flush with the ground when split.

CHEAT
SS		 - Toggles the 'stand while hiding' flag used by the AI system.

CHEAT
SS		 - Toggles the 'must stop when entering this area' flag used by the AI system.

SS		 - Stores the current selected set for later retrieval.

SS		 - If nonzero editing the mesh will incrementally recompue visibility

CHEAT

RELEASE		 - -

net_blockmsg none CHEAT
SS		 - Discards incoming message: <0|1|name>
net_channels cmd NONE - Shows net channel info
net_chokeloop 0 DEVELOPMENTONLY - Apply bandwidth choke to loopback packets
net_compresspackets 1 DEVELOPMENTONLY - Use lz compression on game packets.
net_compresspackets_minsize 1000 DEVELOPMENTONLY - Don't bother compressing packets below this size.
net_compressvoice 0 NONE - Attempt to compress out of band voice payloads (360 only).
net_drawslider 0 NONE - Draw completion slider during signon
net_droppackets 0 CHEAT
SS		 - Drops next n packets on client
net_dumpeventstats cmd NONE - Dumps out a report of game event network usage

net_earliertempents 1 CHEAT
SS		 - -
net_fakejitter 0 CHEAT
SS		 - Jitter fakelag packet time
net_fakelag 0 CHEAT
SS		 - Lag all incoming network data (including loopback) by this many milliseconds.
net_fakeloss 0 CHEAT
SS		 - Simulate packet loss as a percentage (negative means drop 1/n packets)
net_graph 0 CLIENTDLL
ARCHIVE		 - Draw the network usage graph, = 2 draws data on payload, = 3 draws payload legend.

ARCHIVE		 - Height of netgraph panel

ARCHIVE		 - The latency graph represents this many milliseconds.

ARCHIVE		 - Determines whether netgraph font is proportional or not

ARCHIVE		 - Draw the ping/packet loss graph.

ARCHIVE		 - Draw text fields
net_maxcleartime 4.0 NONE - Max # of seconds we can wait for next packets to be sent based on rate setting (0 == no limit).
net_maxfilesize 16 NONE - Maximum allowed file size for uploading in MB
net_maxfragments 1200 NONE - Max fragment bytes per packet
net_maxroutable 1200 ARCHIVE
USERINFO		 - Requested max packet size before packets are 'split'.
net_megasnapshot 1 NONE - -
net_minroutable 16 DEVELOPMENTONLY - Forces larger payloads.
net_paranoid 1 NONE - -
net_public_adr RELEASE - For servers behind NAT/DHCP meant to be exposed to the public internet, this is the public facing ip address string: ("x.x.x.x" )
net_queue_trace 0 ACCESSIBLE_FROM_THREADS - -
net_queued_packet_thread 1 NONE - Use a high priority thread to send queued packets out instead of sending them each frame.

ARCHIVE		 - -

net_showfragments 0 NONE - Show netchannel fragments

net_showpeaks 0 NONE - Show messages for large packets only: <size>

SS		 - -
net_showsplits 0 RELEASE - Show info about packet splits

net_showudp_oob 0 RELEASE - Dump OOB UDP packets summary to console
net_showudp_remoteonly 0 RELEASE - Dump non-loopback udp only
net_showusercmd 0 CLIENTDLL - Show user command encoding
net_splitpacket_maxrate 15000 RELEASE - Max bytes per second when queueing splitpacket chunks
net_splitrate 1 RELEASE - Number of fragments for a splitpacket that can be sent per frame
net_start cmd NONE - Inits multiplayer network sockets
net_status cmd NONE - Shows current network status
net_steamcnx_allowrelay 1 ARCHIVE
RELEASE		 - Allow steam connections to attempt to use relay servers as fallback (best if specified on command line: +net_steamcnx_allowrelay 1)
net_steamcnx_debug 1 NONE - Show debug spew for steam based connections, 2 shows all network traffic for steam sockets.
net_steamcnx_enabled 1 RELEASE - Use steam connections on listen server as a fallback, 2 forces use of steam connections instead of raw UDP.
net_steamcnx_status cmd NONE - Print status of steam connection sockets.
net_usesocketsforloopback 0 NONE - Use network sockets layer even for listen server local player's packets (multiplayer only).

npc_bipass cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Displays the local movement attempts by the given NPC(s) (triangulation detours). Failed bypass routes are displayed in red, successful bypasses are shown in green. Arguments: {entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at.

CHEAT
SS		 - Displays text debugging information about the squad and enemy of the selected NPC (See Overlay Text) Arguments: {npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

CHEAT
SS		 - Displays all the current AI conditions that an NPC has in the overlay text. Arguments: {npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at
npc_create cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Creates an NPC of the given type where the player is looking (if the given NPC can actually stand at that location). Arguments: [npc_class_name] [name of npc (optional) ] [addon type (optional) ] [name of addon (optional) ]
npc_create_aimed cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Creates an NPC aimed away from the player of the given type where the player is looking (if the given NPC can actually stand at that location). Note that this only works for npc classes that are already in the world. You can not create an entity that doesn't have an instance in the level. Arguments: {npc_class_name}
npc_create_equipment GAMEDLL - -

CHEAT

npc_destroy_unselected cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Removes all NPCs from the universe that aren't currently selected
npc_enemies cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Shows memory of NPC. Draws an X on top of each memory. Eluded entities drawn in blue (don't know where it went) Unreachable entities drawn in green (can't get to it) Current enemy drawn in red Current target entity drawn in magenta All other entities drawn in pink Arguments: {npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at
npc_focus cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Displays red line to NPC's enemy (if has one) and blue line to NPC's target entity (if has one) Arguments: {npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

CHEAT
SS		 - Selected NPC(s) will freeze in place (or unfreeze). If there are no selected NPCs, uses the NPC under the crosshair. Arguments: -none-
npc_freeze_unselected cmd GAMEDLL - Freeze all NPCs not selected

CHEAT
SS		 - Selected NPC(s) will go to the location that the player is looking (shown with a purple box) Arguments: -none-

SS		 - Sends all selected NPC(s) to a random node. Arguments: -none-

ARCHIVE		 - Enable test mode for ik height adjustment
npc_kill cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Kills the given NPC(s) Arguments: {npc_name} / {npc_class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

CHEAT
SS		 - Draw's a while box around the NPC(s) nearest node Arguments: {entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

CHEAT

npc_reset cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Reloads schedules for all NPC's from their script files Arguments: -none-
npc_route cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Displays the current route of the given NPC as a line on the screen. Waypoints along the route are drawn as small cyan rectangles. Line is color coded in the following manner: Blue - path to a node Cyan - detour around an object (triangulation) Red - jump Maroon - path to final target position Arguments: {npc_name} / {npc_class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at
npc_select cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - Select or deselects the given NPC(s) for later manipulation. Selected NPC's are shown surrounded by a red translucent box Arguments: {entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

r_paintblob_debug_draw_margin 0 CLIENTDLL - If tiler is disabled, whether to draw the margin.
r_paintblob_debug_draw_tile_boundaries 0 CLIENTDLL - Whether to draw outlines of all tiles.
r_paintblob_debug_spu 0 CLIENTDLL - Set this to 1 to break in the SPU code for the blob. Otherwise use 0.
r_paintblob_display_clip_box 0 CLIENTDLL - -
r_paintblob_draw_isosurface 1 CLIENTDLL - Draws the surface as an isosurface
r_paintblob_force_single_pass 0 CLIENTDLL - If 0, render the blob in two passes. Set to 1 to force rendering of the blob in a single pass.
r_paintblob_highres_cube 0.8 CLIENTDLL - Set cubewidth (coarseness of the mesh)
r_paintblob_mainview_highres 1 CLIENTDLL - If 1, make the main view high resolution. Set to 0 to make the main view low resolution.
r_paintblob_material -1 CLIENTDLL - Choose a material from 0 to N
r_paintblob_max_number_of_indices_displayed 1000000 CLIENTDLL - Indicates the maximum number of indices to display per tile. The index size will be the limiting factor though (regardless of this number).
r_paintblob_max_number_of_threads 4 CLIENTDLL - Indicates the maximum number of threads that will be spawn for the blob.
r_paintblob_max_number_of_vertices_displayed 1000000 CLIENTDLL - Indicates the maximum number of vertices to display per tile. The VB size will be the limiting factor though (regardless of this number).
r_paintblob_only_mainview_displayed 0 CLIENTDLL - If 0, other views are displayed (portal, shadow, reflection, ...). Note that shadows are disabled on game consoles. Set to 1 to only display the main view.
r_paintblob_otherviews_highres 0 CLIENTDLL - If 0, all other views are low resolution. Set to 1 to make other views high resolution.
r_paintblob_rotate 0 CLIENTDLL - Whether to rotate for transparency
r_paintblob_seeding_with_simd 0 CLIENTDLL - Set this to 1 to run the seeding in SIMD. Otherwise use 0.
r_paintblob_shader CLIENTDLL - Choose a shader
r_paintblob_tile_index_to_draw -1 CLIENTDLL - -1 to display all tiles. Otherwise the index of the tile to draw.
r_paintblob_timeout_for_recycling_fragments 100 CLIENTDLL - Timeout in milliseconds used to recycle the fragments. Default is 64 in release, 1000 in debug.
r_paintblob_use_optimized_fragment_copy 1 CLIENTDLL - Indicates if optimized VB/IB copy is enabled (Write-combine memory optimization).
r_paintblob_wireframe 0 CLIENTDLL - Draw wireframe

rr_debugresponseconcept_exclude cmd GAMEDLL - Set a list of concepts to exclude from rr_debugresponseconcept. Separate multiple concepts with spaces. Call with no arguments to see current list. Call 'rr_debug_responseconcept_exclude !' to reset.
rr_debugresponses 0 GAMEDLL - Show verbose matching output (1 for simple, 2 for rule scoring, 3 for noisy). If set to 4, it will only show response success/failure for npc_selected NPCs.
rr_debugrule GAMEDLL - If set to the name of the rule, that rule's score will be shown whenever a concept is passed into the response rules system.

SS_ADDED		 Linux Steam Controller - any movement under this threshold will filtered to prevent jitter

ARCHIVE		 Linux Which pad controls 1:1 look - 0 = off, 1 = left, 2 = right

ARCHIVE
SS_ADDED		 Linux Which pad controls 1:1 look - 0 = off, 1 = left, 2 = right

ARCHIVE		 Linux Steamcontroller momentum decay half life

ARCHIVE		 Linux Velocities below this value will not impart momentum

snd_async_flush cmd NONE - Flush all unlocked async audio data
snd_async_fullyasync 1 NONE - All playback is fully async (sound doesn't play until data arrives).
snd_async_minsize 262144 NONE - -
snd_async_showmem cmd NONE - Show async memory stats
snd_async_showmem_music cmd NONE - Show async memory stats for just non-streamed music
snd_async_showmem_summary cmd NONE - Show brief async memory stats
snd_async_spew_blocking 0 NONE - Spew message to console any time async sound loading blocks on file i/o.
snd_async_stream_fail 0 NONE - Spew stream pool failures.
snd_async_stream_purges 0 NONE - Spew stream pool purges.
snd_async_stream_recover_from_exhausted_stream 1 NONE - If 1, recovers when the stream is exhausted when playing PCM sounds (prevents music or ambiance sounds to stop if too many sounds are played). Set to 0, to stop the sound otherwise.
snd_async_stream_spew 0 NONE - Spew streaming info ( 0=Off, 1=streams, 2=buffers
snd_async_stream_spew_delayed_start_filter vo NONE - Filter used to spew sounds that starts late. Use an empty string "" to display all sounds. By default only the VO are displayed.
snd_async_stream_spew_delayed_start_time 500 NONE - Spew any asynchronous sound that starts with more than N milliseconds delay. By default spew when there is more than 500 ms delay.
snd_async_stream_spew_exhausted_buffer 1 NONE - If 1, spews warnings when the buffer is exhausted (recommended). Set to 0 for no spew (for debugging purpose only).
snd_async_stream_spew_exhausted_buffer_time 1000 NONE - Number of milliseconds between each exhausted buffer spew.
snd_async_stream_static_alloc 0 NONE - If 1, spews allocations on the static alloc pool. Set to 0 for no spew.
snd_cull_duplicates 0 NONE - If nonzero, aggressively cull duplicate sounds during mixing. The number specifies the number of duplicates allowed to be played.
snd_debug_gaincurve 0 NONE - Visualize sound gain fall off
snd_debug_gaincurvevol 1.0 NONE - Visualize sound gain fall off
snd_defer_trace 1 NONE - -
snd_delay_for_choreo_enabled 1 NONE - Enables update of delay for choreo to compensate for IO latency.
snd_delay_for_choreo_reset_after_N_milliseconds 500 NONE - Resets the choreo latency after N milliseconds of VO not playing. Default is 500 ms.
snd_delay_sound_shift 0.03 NONE - -
snd_disable_mixer_duck 0 NONE - -
snd_disable_mixer_solo 0 NONE - -
snd_dsp_cancel_old_preset_after_N_milliseconds 1000 NONE - Number of milliseconds after an unused previous preset is not considered valid for the start of a cross-fade.
snd_dsp_optimization 1 NONE - Turns optimization on for DSP effects if set to 1 (default). 0 to turn the optimization off.
snd_dsp_spew_changes 0 NONE - Spews major changes to the dsp or presets if set to 1. 0 to turn the spew off (default).

snd_vol_no_xfade 5.0 NONE - If current and target volumes are close, don't cross-fade.
snd_vol_xfade_incr_max 20.0 NONE - Never change volume by more than +/-N units per frame during cross-fade.
snd_vol_xfade_speed_multiplier_for_doppler 0.01 NONE - Doppler effect is extremely sensible to volume variation. To reduce the pops, the cross-fade has to be very slow.
snd_vol_xfade_time 0.070 NONE - Channel volume cross-fade time in seconds.

sv_client_max_interp_ratio 5 REPLICATED - This can be used to limit the value of cl_interp_ratio for connected clients (only while they are connected). If sv_client_min_interp_ratio is -1, then this cvar has no effect.
sv_client_min_interp_ratio 1 REPLICATED - This can be used to limit the value of cl_interp_ratio for connected clients (only while they are connected). -1 = let clients set cl_interp_ratio to anything any other value = set minimum value for cl_interp_ratio
sv_client_predict -1 REPLICATED - This can be used to force the value of cl_predict for connected clients (only while they are connected). -1 = let clients set cl_predict to anything 0 = force cl_predict to 0 1 = force cl_predict to 1

CLIENTDLL
REPLICATED		 - Minimum size of pushback objects

CLIENTDLL
REPLICATED		 - How hard physics objects are pushed away from the players on the server.

CLIENTDLL
REPLICATED		 - Maximum amount of force applied to physics objects by players.

CLIENTDLL
REPLICATED
CHEAT
SS		 - Maximum of how hard the player is pushed away from physics objects.

CLIENTDLL
REPLICATED		 - If a player is moving slower than this, don't push away physics objects (enables ducking behind things).

CLIENTDLL

CHEAT
SS		 - How hard the player is pushed away from physics objects (falls off with inverse square of distance).

vprof cmd NONE - Toggle VProf profiler
vprof_adddebuggroup1 cmd NONE - add a new budget group dynamically for debugging
vprof_cachemiss cmd NONE - Toggle VProf cache miss checking
vprof_cachemiss_off cmd NONE - Turn off VProf cache miss checking
vprof_cachemiss_on cmd NONE - Turn on VProf cache miss checking
vprof_child cmd NONE - -
vprof_collapse_all cmd NONE - Collapse the whole vprof tree
vprof_counters 0 NONE - -
vprof_counters_show_minmax 0 NONE - -
vprof_dump_counters cmd NONE - Dump vprof counters to the console
vprof_dump_groupnames cmd NONE - Write the names of all of the vprof groups to the console.
vprof_dump_oninterval 0 NONE - Interval (in seconds) at which vprof will batch up data and dump it to the console.
vprof_dump_spikes 0 NONE - Framerate at which vprof will begin to dump spikes to the console. 0 = disabled, negative to reset after dump
vprof_dump_spikes_budget_group NONE - Budget gtNode to start report from when doing a dump spikes
vprof_dump_spikes_hiearchy 0 NONE - Set to 1 to get a hierarchy report whith vprof_dump_spikes
vprof_dump_spikes_node NONE - Node to start report from when doing a dump spikes
vprof_dump_spikes_terse 0 NONE - Whether to use most terse output
vprof_expand_all cmd NONE - Expand the whole vprof tree
vprof_expand_group cmd NONE - Expand a budget group in the vprof tree by name
vprof_generate_report cmd NONE - Generate a report to the console.
vprof_generate_report_AI cmd NONE - Generate a report to the console.
vprof_generate_report_AI_only cmd NONE - Generate a report to the console.
vprof_generate_report_budget cmd NONE - Generate a report to the console based on budget group.
vprof_generate_report_hierarchy cmd NONE - Generate a report to the console.
vprof_generate_report_hierarchy_per_frame_and_count_only cmd NONE - Generate a minimal hiearchical report to the console.
vprof_generate_report_map_load cmd NONE - Generate a report to the console.
vprof_graph 0 NONE - Draw the vprof graph.
vprof_graphheight 256 ARCHIVE - -
vprof_graphwidth 512 ARCHIVE - -
vprof_nextsibling cmd NONE - -
vprof_off cmd NONE - Turn off VProf profiler
vprof_on cmd NONE - Turn on VProf profiler
vprof_parent cmd NONE - -
vprof_playback_average cmd NONE - Average the next N frames.
vprof_playback_start cmd NONE - Start playing back a recorded .vprof file.
vprof_playback_step cmd NONE - While playing back a .vprof file, step to the next tick.
vprof_playback_stepback cmd NONE - While playing back a .vprof file, step to the previous tick.
vprof_playback_stop cmd NONE - Stop playing back a recorded .vprof file.
vprof_prevsibling cmd NONE - -
vprof_record_start cmd NONE - Start recording vprof data for playback later.
vprof_record_stop cmd NONE - Stop recording vprof data
vprof_remote_start cmd NONE - Request a VProf data stream from the remote server (requires authentication)
vprof_remote_stop cmd NONE - Stop an existing remote VProf data request
vprof_reset cmd NONE - Reset the stats in VProf profiler
vprof_reset_peaks cmd NONE - Reset just the peak time in VProf profiler
vprof_scope NONE - Set a specific scope to start showing vprof tree

vprof_think_limit 0 GAMEDLL - -
vprof_to_csv cmd NONE - Convert a recorded .vprof file to .csv.
vprof_unaccounted_limit 0.3 ARCHIVE - number of milliseconds that a node must exceed to turn red in the vprof panel
vprof_verbose 1 ARCHIVE - Set to one to show average and peak times
vprof_vtune_group cmd NONE - enable vtune for a particular vprof group ("disable" to disable)
vprof_warningmsec 10 ARCHIVE - Above this many milliseconds render the label red to indicate slow code.
vtune cmd NONE - Controls VTune's sampling.
vx_do_not_throttle_events 0 NONE - Force VXConsole updates every frame; smoother vprof data on PS3 but at a slight (~0.2ms) perf cost.

wc_air_edit_further cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - When in WC edit mode and editing air nodes, moves position of air node crosshair and placement location further away from player
wc_air_edit_nearer cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - When in WC edit mode and editing air nodes, moves position of air node crosshair and placement location nearer to from player
wc_air_node_edit cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - When in WC edit mode, toggles laying down or air nodes instead of ground nodes
wc_create cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - When in WC edit mode, creates a node where the player is looking if a node is allowed at that location for the currently selected hull size (see ai_next_hull)
wc_destroy cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - When in WC edit mode, destroys the node that the player is nearest to looking at. (The node will be highlighted by a red box).
wc_destroy_undo cmd GAMEDLL
CHEAT
SS		 - When in WC edit mode restores the last deleted node
